results.title: Energy transfer devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Steam and diesel, and high speed electric trains are all studied as examples of energy transfer, concentrating on electricity generation. A plea for solar-based energy is made.

results.title: Electronics in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Through simple diagrams and explanations this film illustrates the role of valves, transistors, IC’s, oscillators, filters, amplifiers and microprocessors in basic electronics and discusses their application in computers, electrical appliances, sound recording and medical diagnosis.

results.title: Perigord cuisine
results.creator_credit: Regis Dervelle and BCD France - TV Ontario Canada
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the cuisine of the Perigord region in France. Shows the harvesting of the food items used as ingredients. Presents a demostration on how to cook some dishes from the region including scrambled eggs with truffles, truffle feullette, and mousse de foie gras covered with ham and flaky pastry.

results.title: Perhaps you've noticed you're changing
results.brief_description: Dicusses the bodily changes that occur in females at puberty. Uses computer graphics to explain the functions of the reproductive organs and the menstrual process. Also indicates the changes that occur in boys at puberty and illustrates, by a diagram, how conception occurs. Contains some low key comercial promotion.

results.title: Perfumes of France
results.brief_description: The famous perfume of France, from flower to bottle. The cultivation of flower around Grasse in the south of France and the extraction of the essential oils; blending and testing of new perfumes; bottling and marketing the great perfumes.

results.title: People who really count
results.brief_description: A staff training film for use by any company which has recently installed a computer. Considers the way in which a computer work, and by illustration, traces the journey of an order from the initial phone call to the final invoice. Points out the need of accuracy in presenting data.

results.title: People over the Plenty
results.brief_description: The film follows the reconstruction of the Greensborough footbridge after the original cable suspension bridge was swept away in the River Plenty floods of 1974. The Shire of Diamond Valley contracted B.C.S. Consulting Engineers and Surveyors and Gibbs Bright & Co, timber suppliers to rebuild the bridge. The Greensborough Bridge is unique in that it is the first structure of its kind to be made of pine, is the longest footbridge in Australia and was aesthetically designed to blend in perfect harmony with its rural surroundings.

results.brief_description: The theme of this program is how people in three cities Birmingham, Cracow and Vancouver, become involved in a variety of urban political movements.

results.title: People in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The New China No. 2”.
Shows views of life and work on a farming commune near Peking, varied rural scenes, temples and other places of interest, and National Day celebrations including a procession and folk dancing displays.
